artefact.overview: You need a licence to store gas in a storage facility in Northern Ireland
artefact.licence_short_description: Licence to store gas in a storage facility in Northern Ireland.
artefact.licence_overview:
If you wish to store gas in a gas storage facility in Northern Ireland, you must be licensed by the Utility Regulator.

You should enclose the following with your application:

- copies of your annual accounts, auditors' reports and interim accounts
- copies of your Memorandum and Articles of Association
- details of your expertise, and the expertise of any sub-contractors you intend to use, in carrying out operations of this type
- a scale map showing the proposed location of the gas storage facility
- a development plan
- details of your safety mechanisms and procedures
- details of your proposed arrangements for complying with the standard licensing conditions and any modifications requested to those conditions
- an application fee

You must place a notice - including a copy of the application - in the [Belfast Gazette](http://www.belfast-gazette.co.uk/ "Belfast Gazette"){:rel="external"} and in a local newspaper for each area where you intend to operate. You should send a copy of each notice to the Utility Regulator as soon as possible after it is published.

The Utility Regulator has also set out criteria that will be used to assess licence applications. Following a review and consultation process the Utility Regulator will notify the applicant of the decision to grant a licence or not.

If a gas storage licence is granted it will subject to a range of standard and special conditions.
